thread.title: Rain leads to heavy traffic in UAE
thread.title_full: Rain leads to heavy traffic in UAE

title: Rain leads to heavy traffic in UAE
text: Rain leads to heavy traffic in UAE Web Team Filed on February 16, 2017 | Last updated on February 16, 2017 at 08.52 am Share Vote There is no relief for those driving to work as most roads are heavily blocked As rains took over Sharjah and Dubai this morning, the chaos led to heavy traffic for office-goers on their last working day of the week. There is no relief for those driving as most roads are heavily clogged or are experiencing slow-moving traffic. Cloudy, rainy weekend ahead for UAE In Sharjah, the Al Wahda street was clogged with incoming traffic towards Dubai. As expected the Dubai-Sharjah road is experiencing bumper to bumper traffic for a long stretch. In Dubai, the usual spots have heavy traffic like the WTC roundabout, Al Safa street, and areas around Lamcy plaza. Dubai police have reported an accident on Al Khail road near Nad Al Sheba bridge.
